sentence: I was assuming that serverside , the StartLongOperation runs an a worker thread and each call to GetStatus would run on a seperate worker thread .
tag_sequence: O O O O B-Application O O B-Library_Function O O O O O O O O O B-Library_Function O O O O O O O O

sentence: Client-side the calls are async so SL fires off the StartLongOperation and then continues to poll the GetStatus .
tag_sequence: B-Application O O O O O B-Application O O O B-Library_Function O O O O O O B-Library_Function O

sentence: But the GetStatusCompleted does n't get fired until the StartLongOperation has completed .
tag_sequence: O O B-Library_Function O O O O O O B-Library_Function O O O

sentence: Since all Silverlight network communication happens on the UI thread , only one WCF call can happen at a time .
tag_sequence: O O B-Application O O O O O O O O O O B-Library O O O O O O O

sentence: Meaning your StartLongOperation has to complete , and then the client will start the GetStatus call .
tag_sequence: O O B-Library_Function O O O O O O O B-Application O O O B-Library_Function O O

sentence: If you want to test this behavior , fire up Fiddler .
tag_sequence: O O O O O O O O O O B-Application O
